text: Ancient Chernihiv () is the National Architecture-Historical Sanctuary located in the north-eastern Ukrainian city of Chernihiv. It was created at first as an affiliate of the National Sanctuary "Sophia of Kyiv". Since August 1, 1967, the site is a separate entity consisting of 34 monuments of architecture. ==Architectural landmarks== * Dytynets Park of Chernihiv, also known as Chernihiv's motte (earthwork) * Saviour-Transfiguration Cathedral * Trinity Cathedral Monastery * Black Grave (kurgan) * Saint Anthony Caves * Chernihiv Regional Art Museum * Chernihiv's Collegium (see collegium) * House of Lyzohub (Colonel of the Chernihiv's Regiment) * House of Archbishop * Museum of history * Krasna Square * Church of the Archangel Michael * Borisoglebsky Cathedral * Catherine's Church * Pyatnytska Church * Yelets-Dormition Monastery * Trinity-Ilna Monastery with Antonie Caves * Chernihiv Glory Memorial Since 1989, the site is placed on the tentative list of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) as part of "World Heritage", receiving its reference as number 668.Historic Centre of Tchernigov, 9th -13th centuries ==Gallery== File:Чернигов.
